column1: Atarinya is an Elvish term meaning my father. It is recorded twice in J.R.R. Tolkiens work
column2: used once by Elendur (son of Isildur) to his father Isildur
column3: and also long before by Tar-Aldarion to his father Meneldur in NÃºmenor. In both cases
column4: the opposite form would be onya
column5: my son. The same word-ending could be used to create affectionate forms from personal names: for example
column6: Meneldur also called Tar-Aldarion Anardilya (my Anardil - with Anardil being Tar-Aldarions original name).
